attributes.comment:
As an adoptive parent who completed her adoption in 2006. I spent well over
$50,000 to bring home my two children from Russia. Of course the children are
WELL WORTH the money, however, adding another fee onto what is required of
the UNITED STATES is just wrong. Many adoptive families have already spent
tens of thousands of dollars in fertility treatments, foster care, and/or domestic
adoption. Often an international adoption may be the only choice and to increase
the fee required to bring that/those child/ren home is just another straw in
breaking the proverbial camel's back.
Having said that, if you do increase the fee, could you also increase our priority
status? I wanted over THREE MONTHS to have the I-600A processed. I could not
submit my foreign paperwork until this document was completed. I even had to get
my senator involved! To increase the fee without also increasing the service is just
a misuse of funds, in my opinion.
Thank you for your consideration in this matter. I would welcome any opportunity
to answer any questions you may have on this issue or any other adoption-related
discussions.
Sincerely, Kellie R. Zimmer, Avon Park, FL Ph. 863-452-6583
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Kellie Zimmer
